meanings.definition: A person who keeps score in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: The scorekeepers diligently recorded the points during the basketball game.
meanings.sent2: The scorekeepers at the tennis match ensured the accuracy of the scores.
meanings.sent3: The scorekeepers had a friendly competition to see who could keep the most accurate score.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sports, scorekeepers are like silent guardians, preserving the history of each game.
meanings.sent5: The role of scorekeepers is crucial in ensuring fair play and accurate results.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals responsible for recording and maintaining the score during a sporting event.
meanings.sent1: During the soccer match, the scorekeepers worked together to keep track of the goals.
meanings.sent2: The scorekeepers huddled together to discuss any discrepancies in the recorded scores.
meanings.sent3: The scorekeepers joked that they were the real MVPs of the game, holding the key to victory.
meanings.sent4: As the scorekeepers tallied the final points, the tension in the stadium grew palpable.
meanings.sent5: The precision and teamwork of the scorekeepers were evident in the flawless scorekeeping throughout the match.
